Reviews.Title: “Nice place but be careful here!!!”
Reviews.Author: qkslvr0305
Reviews.Content: The Majestic was a nice hotel but I would have to seriously consider staying there again. At check-in, they didn't have our reservation in their computer. Luckily, I printed out my confirmation for our prepaid 2 queen bed suite...they didn't have any suites available that night which we had paid for so we were put in a regular room and changed to the suite for the next two days of our stay there. We were given a free bottle of wine for our troubles but not offered any money back on our prepaid stay. I would have spoken to the manager about this at check-out but that's when we ran into another problem there! WARNING: If you do stay here, double check the entire contents of the mini-bar!!!!!!!!! Verify that everything they say is in there, actually is in there or else they will try charging you for items you never consumed. The manager on duty who was checking us out informed us we were being charged for three items. Since I only had one bottle of water from the mini-bar, I told her this and she immediately went up to our room to check. She came back and told us again the items had been replaced the day before. After a couple of minutes of insisting we had only taken one item, the manager rudely said "Well somebody did". Obviously, she didn't believe us, but finally took the extra items off our bill. That being said, the Majestic was a nice hotel in a nice area, I'm sure these incidents dont happen to everyone but please do yourselves a favor and verify the contents of the mini-bar so there are no issues at check-out. Also, this hotel is definitely not for anyone with a wheelchair. There are steps to get inside, down to the lobby and the elevator is very small.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay in an Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Huberm
Reviews.Content: There are 3 keys to this amazing hotel - the beds are incredibly comfortable, the location is perfect for those looking to spend time in Boystown/Lakeview, and the staff are second to none. My decision to say here (and not earn rewards pts) was a gamble, but I won on this one. I will definately be telling my friends about this place and returning here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dabirds
Reviews.Content: Hotel has the look &feel of an old London hotel. The location is great for a Cubs game Its about a 15-20 minute walk to Wrigley Field with a lot of shops and bars along the way It works as long as you don't have to be in the center of town although it's about a 20 minute bus ride to get there on nice clean on time buses. The area is very nice. The hotel is a block from Lake Shore Drive. We booked one of the sunroom suites and we loved it. Room was spacious & clean. Easy check in and check out Honor bar prices were actually reasonable! We'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: madfanmn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2/16-2/19. The location to the Lake and Boystown is great! We walked everywhere and felt very safe. Our room was nice. We didn't get a suite since we weren't going to spend a lot of time in the room. The space met our needs. My only complaint is that the floors are creaky and we were disturbed by the room above us every morning. If I had to do it over, I would request a room on the top floor. The breakfast is nice and had a variety of things to eat. Overall, we'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: mphillmd
Reviews.Content: One night stay to visit family. Beautiful boutique hotel. Very quiet and clean. Great beds. Parking a challenge if you have a larger car. About a 3 block walk to a parking garage but it's Chicago. Had a suite for just over $100. Great value. Beyond that I highly recommend. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at a dear friend's home”
Reviews.Author: suzanne721
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Majestic a week ago after getting a package (Living Social) deal. I was totally charmed the moment we drove up! The hotel is in the middle of a very quiet, residential street a half block from Lake Shore Drive. It has a very European feel to it which I loved. Our room (120) was a very spacious suite with a small living room and separate bedroom. I loved that it had a mini-bar fridge but also had a small empty fridge to store a bit of food (leftovers) that we had brought. The bathroom was very basic but clean and homey ... felt like staying at a good friend's home, yet equipped with nice toiletries, bathrobes, etc. My only complaint was that the sofa in the living room (which was a pull-out sofa bed) was very uncomfortable to sit on, which I think is typical for pull-out sofas. Very hard. Other than that, and the $22 charge for parking (which we did not have to pay since it was included in our package), the hotel is delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive residential setting”
Reviews.Author: IkariaCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Attractive, old building in a quiet residential street.Smallish. Located within walking distance of a variety of good eateries. Easy access to public transport. Very helpful staff. Very comfortable suite with period dÃ©cor, in good condition. 2 x TVs. Kitchenette. Breakfast included (simple but adequate). Free WiFi. Negatives: â€¢ Not centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: BeyondBlame
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is a hotel that, unlike most chains, offers some charactre, at an affordable price. It doesn't have the size or services of the major hotels, so if you come here it's for the charm. I found the room quite comfortable and well-furnished. The only drawback was that it was a little too bright at night for my taste. The location is not central, but therefore quiet and more relaxed. The metro and restaurants are a 5-10 minute walk away, in a safe area. If you like a brisk walk, I'd recommend taking a morning to stroll down through the parks and some of Chicago's lively neighbourhoods. As is customary in the US, breakfast is fairly minimal. Service is friendly. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel if you're looking for a quiet and not too expensive place with some authenticity.

Reviews.Title: “great getaway”
Reviews.Author: doggydr70
Reviews.Content: I had a Living Social coupon for Majestic. In the past, I have been treated poorly at other hotels when they were presented with a coupon. The Majestic staff was friendly, helpful and very pleasant. The hotel is old, elegant and spotless. I loved the sunroom overling the steet. I recommend this for a wonderful getaway weekend. They also have free parking which is unheard of in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing visit in the Windy City, but good location”
Reviews.Author: jtr2010
Reviews.Content: We reserved a suite (because we were traveling with our 1.5 year-old son), and when we arrived, no suites were available. What? And we were put in an especially small room on the first floor near the front desk. I returned to the front desk and was told no suites were available . . . which made me ask the question, "What is the point of a reservation then?" The front office worker was apologetic and very nice. I asked if any sister hotels had a suite available, and she said no. She did indicate that she would try to offer a discount with permission of the manager, and after discussion with the manager, they did offer a discount on our stay. I have a hard time reviewing this property as my room was not at all what I expected and because I was rather put out. The bathroom was nice and clean, though a bit small, and the room was standard hotel issue -- mini-bar, window air conditioning unit, two beds, etc. The high-speed Internet was nice. The breakfast fare was a bit disappointing -- something I would expect at a Holiday Inn or Budget Inn. The sitting room was lovely and provided a nice place to meet with our friends and the location is quite nice -- good access to the lake and nearby marina. Make sure you get there right at check-in time to make sure you get the room you RESERVED. Oh, and as is to be expected in a large city, parking is rather expensive. Parking is valet, and after you unload, you have to park in a garage around the block and enter the hotel through a circuitous back entrance.

Reviews.Title: “A Chicago Gem !!!”
Reviews.Author: JjJbabcock
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago for both business and pleasure about 10 times a year and always make it a point to stay at the Majestic. It is the perfect big city combination of hotel and B&B for a great price. The location is great, the staff always attentive, the cookies and coffee plentiful, reasonable parking and decent breakfast. The small upgrade to a Sunroom suite is worth the extra since the standard rooms are a bit on the small size and the suites are very large. Mona is a wonderful as are all the staff. Ask for a free day pass to the local fitness club. To sum it up... A great place to stay !

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value!”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: I recently had to travel to Chicago on business and I was shocked at the prices of most hotels in the city. I don't know if something was going on in town but many hotels were booked for my travel dates and I w as not prepared to spend $500 + per night for those that were available. I came across the Majestic on a travel website but had some reservation as I wasn't sure about the location and I did not know the area well. I checked on a map and it seemed pretty convenient. It was just up Lake Shore Drive, so I decided I would give it a go. I could not have been more pleased with my decision. My stay was less than a third of the cost of staying elsewhere, yet I received excellent service, and it was a convenient location (just a five minute cab ride from downtown) . In these difficult economic times it was refreshing to find a good value. More importantly, its the little things that count. (Which also happen to be where most Hotels gouge you). While the Hotel has a quaint older charm, it did not lack any modern amenities. They have free wifi, large flatscreen TV's and a low priced 24hr interactive movie/entertainment package. I could not believe the pricing for the mini-bar/snacks which were only $1-$2 each. My room was large, clean and the bed was very comfortable. I travel quite a bit for business and rarely do I encounter this type of overall value. The Majestic provides a great service at a very reasonable price. i will stay there again when I travel to Chicago and with the savings that I get from avoiding those high priced Hotels, I plan to enjoy a nice day of shopping on Magnificent Mile!

Reviews.Title: “The Majestic--Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: GeaugaJohn
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Nov 20th, to warm and friendly greetings. Staff was very helpful in getting our luggage to the room (the Sunroom Suite). The room was quite large, the "sunroom" sitting area had a nice view, and the tiny kitchen was sufficient for our needs for four nights. The continental breakfast was adequate, the coffee quite good. It was also a nice treat to have coffee, tea and cookies in the afternoon. As others have stated, this hotel has the charm of an old, European hotel. The heating system took a little bit to get used to, but was not a big deal. The bed was comfortable, the rooms quiet. The assistant manager was extremely kind and helpful. All in all, it was a great experience, and we plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boystown location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Journeyman067
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed here a weekend this fall. It is within walking distance of Halstead and very close to Lake Michigan. The room was quite large with a separate seating area from the two beds. It had a microwave and a mini fridge but no coffee maker. The lack of a coffee maker wasn't a big deal because there was always coffee in the lobby area. The room was clean and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. The only reason this place doesn't get a 5 is because the decor could use some sprucing up.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, friendly, good service”
Reviews.Author: cheapskate1959
Reviews.Content: The only reason I did not give this hotel 5 stars is that it is like the home of an elderly lady who has seen better days. Radiators and wall space heaters, worn carpets. BUT great location, a feel of faded elegance, linens are great, beds comfortable, service excellent, quiet location on the north side where it is hard to find a good place to stay, all at fair prices (except weekends when it can be a bit higher than a nice place downtown....) Very nice sitting room with breakfast that feels like the living room of a faded mansion.

Reviews.Title: “Already made another reservation”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the Lakeview neighborhood (Boystown) but with easy transportation to downtown. A boutique hotel, it doesn't offer the same kind of amenities as a big chain but comfortable rooms, pleasant and helpful staff made it a joy.

Reviews.Title: “Try it! You'll like it.”
Reviews.Author: PacMan1946
Reviews.Content: The Majectic is an older building which has been converted to a boutique hotel. While some other reviews said is was not up to standards, I totally disagree. When we checked in I asked about an upgrade to a sunroom suite and sure enough one was available for just $20 dollars more. It was more than worth it as we had plenty of room. The decor was charming, it reminded be of romantic old movie sets from the 1950's. Yet, all the furniture, bedding, etc. was new, clean and comfortable. Yes, it is an old building with radiators and window air conditioners. But, if you like to stay in a place that feels like home. This can provide it. Plus, it is obvious that the management/owners of the hotel care about the guests. The attention to detail was very nice, soft robes, plenty of towels, soft lighting, two flat screen tv's, fridge, microware, wet bar. The common parlor on the main floor is beautifully decorated and you can have friends/guests come and visit you here during your stay. Plus, coffee, tea, etc. it available 24/7. A good continental breakfast is served in this room too. What's more is that it is only a few minutes walk to Broadway and all the most popular Boystown venues. We will definitely stay here again and again. It's one of the best buys in Chicago as well - about half the price of a hotel around Water Tower Place. So try it! I think you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional-style hotel at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: KCT888
Reviews.Content: Majestic is an old style hotel if that is to your liking, pleasant, classy, on a relatively quiet tree lined street, yet readily accessible to the north/south Lakeshore Drive. We had a suite type room, which was large and spacious, well appreciated for a four night stay. Continental breakfast was adequate if ordinary. Our stay was trouble-free, service was efficient but not remarkable. Parking is with a garage one street over which means about a 5min walk and waiting for your car to be retrieved each morning, but that worked out ok. It also means adding $22 to your daily stay. We booked on a special rate, which was reasonable/good for Chicago. The standard rate would be pricey for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal”
Reviews.Author: elastopathy
Reviews.Content: The lobby has charm and the staff are pleasant and helpful. My room, however, fell just short of being yucky and gross. I'll walk you through it. Open the door. There's no extra night-bolt security latch, by the way. The room opens into a long and dimly lit narrow hallway that wastes what minimal space there already is. At the end of the hall is a rod to hang clothes, but no closet. Turn left and there is a window looking out on an alley whose view of dumpsters is obscured only by the air-conditioner in the middle of the window and the dingy and broken vinyl Venetian blinds as well as the fire escape and tangle of wires coming from the utility pole outside. It's unclear whether the window locks completely, because of the way the air-conditioner is placed in it. The drapes cannot be completely drawn, and the adjacent yellow sodium vapor lamp just outside shines brightly into the room at night. On the opposite wall is a small electric space heater, yet on an adjacent wall there is also a steam radiator with a strange wire coming out of it. Take your pick of three unsightly devices to heat and cool the room. Watch where you walk. The carpet is dirty and worn and the floor boards are not just creaky, but actually seem mushy enough to push your foot through the floor below. The bed takes up all but a few inches of the room and was nicely made and the linens seemed clean enough. The small bathroom with little space to store so much as a shaving kit was surprisingly modern and clean - except for the floor, again, with orange stains in the tile grout and the towels with larger matching orange stains.

Reviews.Title: “A charming, historic, and generally well-maintained hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Johannes56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic Hotel for the first week of September 2010. Given that it has taken me twelve months to finally write a review it is entirely possible that my review may be outdated and my comments no longer applicable. I chose the Majestic for a number of reasons. First, I like to stay in accommodation that is unique to a city and I try to avoid the big chain hotels whenever I can. Second, the Majestic was/is close to where a friend currently lives. Third, it was recommended to me by another friend who had stayed at the hotel a year or two before. Overall I enjoyed my stay at the Majestic. Although the hotel is old and the furniture perhaps somewhat dated, that is part of the hotelâ€™s charm and, despite its age, my impression is that the hotel is generally well-maintained. I had little to complain about regarding my room, with only one exception mentioned below. I was lucky enough upon arrival to have my room upgraded from a Standard Queen to a King Suite with a den overlooking quiet, tree-lined West Brompton Place. The King Suite (Room #101) was wonderfully spacious, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom spotless, and the large windows in the den helped to create a bright and sunny environment. What I didnâ€™t find so good about the room was the air-conditioning, which did not operate very effectively, in my opinion. There was always some dampness to the air even after the air-conditioning unit had been running for an hour or so. I should note that the air-conditioning unit in my room was ancient and probably needs to be replaced, if it hasnâ€™t been replaced already. The plastic frame covering the unit was badly cracked and had a propensity to fall off. The unit was also quite loud when it was operating and I usually had to turn the dial to the least powerful setting to ensure a good nightâ€™s sleep. Something else that bothered me a bit was what I would characterize as a musty smell that pervaded the room. Whether this odor was related to the poor air-conditioning, I donâ€™t know. The musty odor was most obvious as soon as I came back from a dayâ€™s sightseeing. Nevertheless, I should make it clear that it wasnâ€™t necessarily an unpleasant odor and, moreover, I would always find that I didnâ€™t notice it very much after an hour or so back in the room. Meanwhile, I should also make clear that I never noticed any signs of mold or mildew in the room and, upon reflection, I now have to wonder if the smell was nothing more than the odor of an old building with old furnishings! :-) On a more positive note, I found the service at the Majestic to be exceptionally good and very professional. Two staff who were working at the Majestic at the time I visited and who might still be there, Richard and Gustavo, were particularly helpful. Richard provided useful transportation tips on how to get to the hotel from Oâ€™Hare when I called to confirm my reservation, and during my stay Gustavo similarly provided good information on which buses to take to get to downtown and to certain specific sights. Gustavo was also very patient with me when I kept returning to the reception desk to replace/recode the access cards to my room when the cards mysteriously stopped functioning. Indeed, my room access cards failed at least four or five times during my stay and it took a while to figure out why this was happening. When sightseeing and using my camera, I would often place my camera case into the same pocket where I had placed my access card. What I hadnâ€™t taken into consideration was the fact that the camera case has a small magnet embedded in the caseâ€™s cover flap. It eventually dawned on me that it was quite likely the magnet that was messing up the coding entered into the access cards. Once I began putting the camera case into a different pocket, the problem with the access cards ceased! With any luck the hotel is now using less sensitive room access cards! :-) The Lakeview neighborhood where the Majestic is situated is predominantly residential and is a quiet, beautiful, and safe neighborhood to explore. There are a number of good restaurants in the area, especially on North Broadway and North Halsted and a couple of grocery stores nearby as well. The hotel provides breakfast in its ground floor common area and although what is provided is nothing special, itâ€™s O.K. and is enough to get one going in the morning. Meanwhile, the hotel is only a half block away from the bus stop on North Lakeshore Drive and bus service along Lakeshore Drive to downtown Chicago is very good (the travel time by bus was usually no more than twenty minutes). Finally, as many reviewers have noted, the Majestic is ideally situated for people who want to catch a baseball game at Wrigley Field; the venerable baseball stadium is only a ten to fifteen minute walk from the hotel. All in all, the Majestic provides decent accommodation in a wonderful neighborhood and should be considered by anyone who wants to stay somewhere else other than Chicagoâ€™s downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, tiny. Pre-check the out of date snacks in the mini bar.”
Reviews.Author: Tom L
Reviews.Content: Luckily my stay here was just 2 nights. The room was no larger than the queen sized bed. The bed was very comfortable though. The bathroom amenities ie shower gel and liquid soaps were heavenly and the robe was a very nice touch. Beware of the products in the mini bar; many of them were out of date and stale. The only space to place my clothes was a make shift file cabinet in a small space near the door. The staff was barely visible. The room was clean except for the dark hair visible on the white bathroom floor. Excellent location in East Lakeview but VERY hard to find this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base in the city"”
Reviews.Author: Hoopester1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 30 and 31. We have stayed at The Majestic several times before because it is close to our son's apartment in Lakeview. It is a great location if you want to be able to walk to the. neighborhood's great little restaurants, bars, and shops. The lakefront is a five minute walk and you can use the pedestrian tunnel that goes under Lakeshore Drive. There you can watch the world go by on foot, bicycle, skates, etc. We were offered an upgrade for $20 when we checked in so our King room ended up having a sunroom overlooking the street which was a treat. The room was very clean although there had been a leak from a recent torrential rain storm which Maintenance responded to. The common areas of the hotel are small but gracious. As another reviewer said, it is time for them. to replace the carpet in the hallways and lounge but otherwise, it is a comfortable and welcoming place to stay on the middle of the city. It will continue to be my top choice in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Stillwater54
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Majestic Hotel for 3 nights! The staff we met were very courteous and professional. The continental breakfast was plentiful and very well organized. We especially enjoyed being so close to the lake and only blocks to Wrigleyville. The rooms were very spacious and very comfortable! We will definitely recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel close to Wrigley”
Reviews.Author: rtmuss
Reviews.Content: If you're interested in a very comfortable hotel close to Wrigley I highly recommend the staying at The Majestic Hotel. Our room, a king suite, offered plenty of space and an unusually comfortable bed. This is an older building and there was some wear, but there was also a good deal of charm. The complimentary breakfast was very adequate and the staff was helpful and very available. This was our first visit to Chicago. We found the area to be quite safe with a number of good restaurants within walking distance. It was very easy to use public transportation to get into the heart of the city. On a few occasions we walked along Lakeshore Drive and returned by bus. There was no need to rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Denisev1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here June 9th and 10th and thought it was a good value. It is a solid 10 min brisk walk from the "L" but only about a 5 minute walk to the bus stop that takes you more directly to all the main tourist destinations. If you're staying for more than a couple of days, buy a 3 day Transit card which works on bus and "L" routes, well worth the money. Rooms are small but comfortable, breakfast is very pleasant and had hard cooked eggs in addition to continental selections, front desk staff very helpful with booking half price tickets day of show to Chicago the musical since I didn't have a computer. Hotel was able to recommend reasonably priced restaurants within walking distance, as hotel is in a very nice but not over priced area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pegnbuck
Reviews.Content: Majestic is a great little hotel in the Lakeview district. Close to everything we needed. They were very accommodating about anything we requested and the $22 parking fee was reasonable for Chicago. Will definitely stay here they next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Jennykane
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a friend for two nights. The hotel was clean, the beds were wonderful and we stayed in a suite. The hotel had a basic color scheme of brown. The location is really great and until we checked out, we had a nice stay. Upon checking out, there was a discrepancy with parking. We were told that we could leave the car in a parking garage while we went to a museum and that was not the case. We were cornered into paying an extra 25.00. Now, I'm not a petty person and if the employees of the Majestic had been nice, I'm sure I would be ok with paying 25.00. However, the hotel took absolutely no responsibility, blamed other staff members, and they were very condescending. I was very shocked at this poor behavior. I left a scathing note with improvements on their parking situation. The manager did call me after I left the note and refunded my money. There are many other BETTER hotels, that treat their guests like guests and not an annoying pest.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price, Great Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: TexasPaula
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is an all around great hotel. It feels intimate due to its small size. The location is great! We walked to the Cubs game, walked to Lincoln Park Zoo and you can see Lake Michigan from the hotel. It is also close to bus stops. The staff are very helpful, never seemed to tire of our questions and requests for advice (first timers to Chicago). They will send the bell boy out to Lakeshore to fetch a cab. The rooms are comfortable and tastefully decorated. We stayed in a sun room suite, loved it! Our room had a very fair priced honor bar that is well-stocked, plus another fridge and a microwave. Comfy bed and pillows. Very clean, like-new tub and fixtures in the bath. I slept like a baby at this hotel, which never happens for me. Very little noise from interior or exterior. We would definitely stay at the Majestic again!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Chic in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: MHTbased
Reviews.Content: I am a chain-hotel-business guy but couldn't find a room in town due to conventions.This hotel had one room left, so I decided to give it a try instead of staying way out by the airport. The staff was very friendly, ready to help with luggage or restaurant reccomendation. The rooms are a bit dated, but they are clean, I had a one-bedroom suite and it was very roomy and comfortable. Apparently this is very close to Wrigley if you are a Cubs fan. But the neightborhood is a real treat in which to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: jlib
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Majestic hotel many times and also rented their executive suite for business meetings. The hotel staff are extremely accommodating and very friendly. The rooms are very nice and the breakfast bar in the morning is wonderful! In addition, the location is perfect! would highly recommend the Majestic Hotel when staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Chicago Traveler - The only place I will stay!”
Reviews.Author: CosmoDodger
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago about once a month for business and The Majestic Hotel is my favorite place to stay. The staff is professional, kind, warm and willing to help in any way they can. The hotel is a boutique style hotel and it has a charm that you just cannot find at bigger hotels... more personalized service! The lobby is one of my favorite features of the hotel, with a fireplace and plenty of cozy seating nooks. I love that the hotel is in a quiet neighborhood that is walking distance from wonderful restaurants, the lakefront ad all its activities and Wrigleyville. I would highly recommend The Majestic Hotel to anyone visiting Chicago. I know I will be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Not particularly 'Majestic'”
Reviews.Author: Nethercote
Reviews.Content: in fact very old, dated, dark, dank and scruffy looking. Location is way out of town (a USD15 cab fare to downtown). Service is tolerable but not great, no bell boys to help with luggage, breakfast items often run out of and not replenished, coffee and tea in lobby frequently empty and not replenished etc etc. Even room service was only stuff that could be microwaved by the front desk staff and you had to go down a pick it up yoursef. I know this place is only listed as 2 and a half stars but we paid more for this hotel per night than we paid for a 4* extremely nice hotel in New York City right next to the Empire State Building?!? Very disappointed and don't think it was very good value for money at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with easy access to Wrigley Field”
Reviews.Author: CamAndPhoebsDad
Reviews.Content: I learned of this hotel while preparing for a business trip to Chicago. My colleagues and I wanted somewhere that had easy access to Wrigley Field since we planned to attend an evening game while there. I believe the Majestic was the only hotel within walking distance of the ballpark that got decent reviews. We were not disappointed. Transportation from O'Hare was easy enough: get on the Blue Line of the "El," get off at Addison Station, then take the 152 bus east to Pine Grove. The Majestic is perhaps a half-block away. Check-in was easy and fast (we had made reservations earlier the week before). We got to our rooms, cleaned up, then headed to Wrigley Field. The walk to Wrigley is easy, and at no time did we worry about safety. (Admittedly, it was three men, but the neighborhood where the Majestic is located is fairly affluent residential, and also there is a police station close by. Walking back (around midnight) was also fine. I slept fine--though I had been awake since 4 am, so I was pretty exhausted. The one negative was the poor breakfast. It is your run-of-the-mill continental breakfast, bad coffee and all. They could pay more attention to this service. Other than that, the Majestic met our needs: clean, comfortable room in a safe location within walking distance of a national treasure, Wrigley Field.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem near Wrigley Field and the lake.”
Reviews.Author: abt8786
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stay at The Majestic Hotel while we attending a Cubs game. We all enjoyed our experience. The location was great, walking distance to Wrigley Field, Wrigleyville, and the lake. The front desk staff were very helpful in suggesting different restaurants to try and bars to go to. The lobby has a very welcoming feel and the breakfast was perfect. The room was very clean and the honor bar and basket items were reasonably priced. Overall, the experience was great and fit our needs in Chicago and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: silentstill
Reviews.Content: The Majestic looks great online. Nice looking rooms, decently located, pretty good rates for Chicago. Actuality is the hotel is tucked way down in-between high rise buildings. The first floor rooms are numbered in the 400's to give the allusion that it is a real building. The rooms are just as cramped as the building is. Our double queen room was barely 20 x 20, and all crowded with odd furniture. There were TWO refrigerators in our room...and the hotel is bragging about how green it is? Which leads me to my biggest gripe with this establishment, which is the manner in which the staff behaved towards their guests. Upon arrival, I was greeted by a bellhop who was indifferent about helping with our luggage. Ummm.....do you work for tips? He asked me if I wanted help at the front desk and I told him yes, we would need a luggage cart brought to the front of the hotel. Because the lobby of the hotel is actually underground, due to above mentioned architecture, the bellhop informed me that they couldn't get their luggage carts to the front door because of the flight of stairs leading to street level. OK, so I just carried all our luggage in- four trips. The bellhop just watched....The desk attendant informed us about their "green" policy for washing towels, which is basically that they don't come into your room and switch out your towels during your stay, unless you ask for clean towels. I said to just leave our towels (and room) alone for our stay. However, this was not communicated, and housekeeping entered our room the next day and cleaned it while we were out on the town. Normally I would be ok with this minor mix up, but not only did they clean our room, they took the liberty of moving our personal items, such as our snacks on the kitchenette, and removing what they considered "trash", which included various newspapers and bags/boxes we had from shopping.....ummmm thanks for checking in with me on that, housekeeping. Feel free to just drop in anytime...The hotel was noisy all night, as there are concert venues nearby and lots of people coming and going from these and bars. The staff accused us -twice!!!- of smoking in the room, which was untrue and unfounded, and they actually entered our room twice during our stay to "check" for smoking. By the way, you sign a $200 cleaning-fee-for-smoking contract when you check in. So obviously, we would not smoke in the room. The hotel did smell like smoke all the time, mainly because of all the concert kids out in front smoking. Everytime the front door opened, the wind carried it in. I was absolutely insulted and infuriated by these "room checks", like I was living in a dormitory. I am pretty sure that the Majestic uses this a way to increase revenue- a nice surcharge on your bill based on nothing. They did not charge us, and although they accused us it was obvious that we had not been smoking in the room, therefore the matter was dropped....until we tried to check out, and the manager made us do a walk through of the room to check for smoke. Absolutely ridiculous. Again, no smoke, ashes, cigarettes, rolling papers, nothing... just a stern warning that they dont allow smoking here. Yeah, we got the point when we signed the contract! Ughhh....I love Chicago, I travel there for leisure and business all the time, and I will never stay at the Majestic again. You shouldn't either, honestly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice staff, nice location”
Reviews.Author: bwsmoney
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Not new or large, but very nicely updated. Free breakfast was adequate, but limited. There is a nice sitting area were breakfast is served, but it's not a great place to eat, so just take it back to your room. Elevator is tiny, maybe the smallest I've ever seen. Room: Nice suite with separate living and sleeping areas and a kitchenette. Flatscreen TVs in both living and sleeping rooms, free wi-fi, separate in-room honor bar with additional mini-fridge. It was very homey and comfy! Unfortunately we could hear the neighbor snoring. Location: If you are looking into this hotel for a Cubs game, the answer is YES. We walked west on Addison to Clark St. a couple times and it took 10 minutes. If you need the EL, it is there too. If you don't want to walk, the 152 bus takes you right there. There are a couple grocery stores, a couple convenience stores, and quite a few restaurants and shops within walking distance. Walk east a half block to Lake Shore and you can hop on the 146 bus to the Mag Mile, Downtown, & Museum campus. Parking: It's Chicago, so parking on the street is a challenge. If you can't find a spot, park in the garage on Addison. It is valet, so unload your stuff at the hotel unloading zone first. You can pay for the parking garage at the hotel and get in-out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Majestic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lordhavemercy
Reviews.Content: My DD and I are staying @ The Majestic Hotel on Brompton Place, right now. Couldn't be more pleased. The staff is excellent in helpfulness AND efficiency. Decor is lovely. We walked in the entry and my Daughter remarked on how much The Majestic reminded her of the Inns we visited in Europe. We reserved one of the Sunroom-Suites. What an enjoyable room. Plenty of space to spread-out in. Very clean throughout. Bed is extremely comfortable and bed-linens are very soft and of excellent quality. Bathroom is very clean and nicely decorated with hand-soap, body-lotion, body-shampoo, hair-conditioner and hair-shampoo dispensers in the shower and at the sink. The shower delivers excellent pressure and plenty of hot-water. There are 2 flat-screen tv's. One tv is in the bedroom area and the other is in the sun-room/sitting-room. Bedroom tv is fitted with ROOM LINX Interactive TV. There is a "butler-pantry" style area with deep porcelain bar-sink, small refrigerator and microwave. All were exceptionally clean. Lovely, thick robes are provided as is a pedestal make-up mirror, iron and blow-dryer.. We have thoroughly enjoyed the sun-room/sitting-room. Since we are here to weather out the Blizzard of 2011, the view from the sun-room provides non-stop self-determined weather updates... Lovely, safe neighborhood where we have watched neighbors helping neighbors and strangers alike. There is a $22/day parking garage available. However, we were able to acquire a parking space right on the street. We will definitely be returning...what a gem of a hotel. I hope that they make no alterations to this property...as it is truly charming, just as it is... and a rare treat ...!

Reviews.Title: “Best neighborhood hotel in Wrigleyville”
Reviews.Author: rip2632
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is small, tidy, charming, convenient to the lakefront and Wrigleyville, and staffed by very efficient, helpful people. Rates are very affordable, and some of the rooms are on the small side, so it's well worth spending a few extra dollars to enjoy one of the rooms with a separate sitting area / sunroom. But if you're looking for an intimate, neighborhood hotel with character rather than one of the chain hotels while visiting Chicago, this is a terrific option.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: kepfree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic over Thanksgiving weekend. The hotel is very charming. We stayed in the sun suite, which is like a king room with a sun room overlooking the street. The sun room was a great place to have coffee and read the paper in the morning. It's in a nice neighborhood that was safe to walk in after dark. There is a bus stop about a 1/2 block down the street that is convenient for hopping the bus to Lincoln Park or Michigan Avenue. We got a 3-day CTA pass at the grocery store, so easy to use and much easier than driving/parking. The staff can help you with the buses. They are great. They are courteous, friendly, and very helpful. Special thanks to Gustavo and Richard for all your suggestions and help.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, lovely, clean, quiet, great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Flatlander3
Reviews.Content: I'm from the Chicago area and lived in Chicago for 8 years. I currently live abroad and we were back to visit family and wanted a couple nights in the city. Decent downtown hotels started around $250 night...a little more than we wanted to spend. When I came across the Majestic on Trip Advisor I was sold. I used to live in that neighborhood (Lakeview/ Boystown) and loved it. The hotel is on a quiet street one block from the lake and buses to downtown. The room was large, clean and eco friendly (soap/shamppo dispensers rather than the wasteful mini bottles). The bed was heaven...I usually never sleep through the night on a hotel bed but this one was so comfortable! Breakfast was pretty decent for "continental"...bagels, muffins, cereal, hard boiled eggs, fruit, yogurt, oj, coffee, tea. I just can't say enough about how comfortable, affordable and lovely our stay at the Majestic was!

Reviews.Title: “WE ENJOYED OUR STAY AT THE MAJESTIC”
Reviews.Author: historymajor
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is very old, it was originally built as a shelter for women and converted into a hotel 13 years ago. the elevator was so small three people without luggage were crowded. our room was very nicely decorated, it obviously had been an apt in an earlier life. we had a large living room with t.v. and self-serve refrigerator, an area that had probably been a small galley kitchen...ours had microwave, another fridge and double closets. another t.v. in the bedroom. the bathroom was adequate but it struck us as odd that there are no towel racks or rings, no where to really hang a hand/bath towel. very quite location in an area of apts and homes. the transit from o'hare was easy. take the train to the addison/blue station, then #151 bus to within a block and a half from the hotel. if you are going downtown, you simply walk around the corner and pick up that bus. you are steps away from lake michigan but no sand on the beach at this area although you can get on the walking path here also. we were happy with our stay and felt the hotel was a good value....just be aware that it is a very old property.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel NOT in downtown Chicago or in suburbs.”
Reviews.Author: rejophil
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Majestic twice now when we visit family in Chicago who do not have room for us in their condo. The location is great because we are ten minutes from Lincoln Square area where our son and family are. Finding a place not in the downtown area or out in suburbs is not easy. Staff here is pleasant, rooms spacious, breakfast included. All the amenities you would expect. You have to pay for use of parking garage but it was still much more convenient for us than being downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the Wrigley area”
Reviews.Author: tampa33629
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Majestic many times and it is probably one of my favorite places to stay in the US. Just got back from a week's stay and everything was perfect. I joined the Broughton club so I got 20% off (I think) entire stay as well. Close to lake, Wrigley, nightlife, L trains, etc, but very quiet and quaint. I have a lot of friends in the area so it is fits my needs perfectly. Reminds me of being in Europe. Glad they added the ability to go to the Fitness Formula Club just north of the property. Will never stay anywhere else in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location! Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: designergirl2009
Reviews.Content: Majestic Hotel is an easy walk of local restaurants, Wrigley Field, Lakeshore and Metro Station (Addison-Red line), grocery and pharmacy. Completely quiet, safe neighborhood. Loved it for a 7 night stay! Hotel is better than average. Beds are very comfortable...pillows fluffy, and spotlessly clean. Let air conditioner run all night to block out hotel / early garbage truck sounds. The "garden rooms" are very spacious and pleasant. Staff is very helpful. Taxi service will send car to the front door or it is an easy 1/2 block walk to hail a taxi to anywhere in 30 seconds or less on Lakeshore Drive. 30 minutes by taxi from O'Hare....the best way to go between hotel and airport. The only thing I would change..... the minimal breakfast fare that doesn't change and is just the basic dry cereal, hard boiled egg, fresh oranges or apples and bagels with grape jelly. There is an excellent breakfast/lunch place just a three block walk where we ate to break the monotony.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT boutique-hotel experience in a FANTASTIC location for a GREAT value”
Reviews.Author: SH-from-JCMO
Reviews.Content: Next time I stay in Chicago, The Majestic will be my top choice for accommodations. We were looking for a hotel in the more northern part of the city so we'd be nearer to the things we planned to visit (Wrigley Field for a Cubs game and the Riviera Theatre for a concert). The location was perfect -- we were within walking distance to Wrigley, within walking distance to an L station, and with several bus stops just a block away we could quickly and easily get to the theater or to downtown's major attractions and shopping. The neighborhood setting of this hotel was very enjoyable - made us feel like "locals" for a while, which was fun (a minor drawback to this neighborhood setting is the limited parking -- if you aren't lucky enough to find a free, non-metered spot on the street, you'll have to park a block away and it's pretty expensive). The staff is friendly (thanks, Gustavo, for your graciousness!) and the accommodations were small but quaint, clean, and comfortable. While there is no pool or fitness center on-site, the hotel does offer access to a local gym about 3 blocks away - it was easy to find and the gym's staff was welcoming to guests. A nice and unexpected plus was the complimentary continental breakfast --- that definitely helps on the travel budget. Overall, the Majestic was a real treat. Can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have wished for a better location”
Reviews.Author: n6travellerLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and a half and were very pleased with our choice. The hotel is in a nice neighbourhood and close to boystown. The El wasn't too far away and there were plenty of buses available on Lake Shore Drive, no more than a two minute walk away. We had a Sunroom Suite which was situated at the front of the hotel and were very pleased with our room. It was spacious and I think it represented excellent value for money. Having the separate sitting room was great ( and it lived up to its title as for most of the day it was sunny!).All the staff we encountered were very pleasant. The breakfast was complimentary but as we were there for more than a couple of days, we did get bored of it but there were plenty of places to get breakfast within a ten minute walk. It was also great to be staying out of the centre because it gave us the chance to explore a different neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Wrigley!!”
Reviews.Author: kliesemeyer
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room with a king..this must have been a basic room with was nice and clean, but very very crampted. I asked about an upgrade to anohter room that was $20 more. They gladly moved us and I recommend this to anyone..pay the $20 more. The room is almost triple in size. In fact I believe these rooms surround the smaller rooms. The larger room had a nice seating area, 2 TVs, desk, and king size bed as well. The room was so nice we ordered Giordano's pizza (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!) delivered. Service was extremely helpful!! Even kept our items in a locked room as we attended an afternoon Cubs game. The walk is about 15-20 min from the ballpark, but its though nice neighborhoods. I couldn't find a negative to report about this hotel except for the size of our original room..ohh and breakfast is pretty bland..cereal..same boring stuff you get these days. I went back to my room and ate leftover pizza :-) also free interent...oh and parking is a little pricey at $22 per 24 hours

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and location even with the groaning floor boards"”
Reviews.Author: SWDCRED
Reviews.Content: The Majestic was a DEAL-the location to everything was fantastic and the staff were friendly and very outgoing. The only problem was that the floors groan a bit so bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper. I am planning on coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, friendly staff, comfortable rooms - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Roberta33
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Majestic. We had a fantastic time from the moment we stepped foot in the door. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful, especially Richard and Mona. Mona was like a mother hen making sure we had everything we needed, giving us recommendations for restaurants (several within walking distance), encouraging us to take the bus. One night there was a tornado warning and she worried about everyone who went out into the storm and insisted the rest of us stay there in the lobby with her. We had a delightful conversation with her during the storm. Wouldn't want to be anywhere else when a tornado comes through Chicago. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very nicely updated. The lobby was nice with comfy couches and tables decorated in an old world elegance. The elevator was small but adequate. The neighborhood is very nicely kept up and we were impressed with how clean it is and how nicely landscaped each apartment bldg. was even if it was only a 5x5 ft piece of property. We walked around several evenings and always felt safe. Breakfast was typical hotel continental style food....cereal, yogurt, bagels, muffins. Coffee and cookies available all day. The hotel is only a block from the bus stop and with help from Mona and Richard, we bought a pass and took the bus downtown (about a 10-15 minute ride) several times over. Very easy to navigate. When we return to Chicago, Mona will be the first person we'll call about securing us a room. We know she'll do her best to accommodate us.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ashrn29
Reviews.Content: We arrived sunday night after traveling for 5 hours and could not wait to sit and relax. However, when we opened the front door to the hotel, there was a horrific "old, musty" smell." I moved past that but when we arrived on the second floor shoved in a corner of the hotel it was of great disappointment the moment we opened the door. The room was extremely small as well as the bathroom, The only thing that was updated in the room was a flat screen tv. There wasn't a lot of room to move around or put your belongings. The second day we were gone all day sight seeing and when we returned, we found our hotel room slightly open. Yes left open after housekeeping had remade the bed. I was furious at this point. I called the main desk and there was no apology just i will talk with the head housekeeper. I felt that was not enough. You could at least apologize what if something had been taking because of your staff not paying attention!!! I would not recommend this hotel at all, spend the extra money and stay somewhere with class!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cellii
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took my parents to The Majestic to celebrate my mother's75th birthday this weekend. We all had a very pleasant experience! We were upgraded to two of their Sunsuites which include a small sitting room with T.V. We loved the countryhouse charm of the place and the large sittingroom with fireplace where we had breakfast each morning.This is a very peaceful hotel in a quiet neighbor and the beds are heavenly. The staff members were all very helpful and friendly - especially Jennfer who helped us with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, quaint Brownstone style hotel in Lincoln Park.”
Reviews.Author: maxanddrew
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Majestic was pleasant. It is a nicely appointed Brownstone style hotel within walking distance to the Briar Street theatre where Blue Man Group is playing. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. We were always acknowledged with a genuine smile and hello whenever we crossed paths with the any member of the staff, top down. Our room was the basic single queen. It was small room, but not too small by big city hotel standards. With the queen bed nearly pushed up against one wall, negotiating the space was a bit tight. I would recommend booking one of the larger rooms if you are a staying as a couple. I was impressed with the bed linens and pillows. Sage velvet throw pillows and quilt at the end of the bed helped make the bed double as a chaise. The robes are a nice touch. The towels were standard issue, scratchy hotel type. The bathroom was small, but updated. High marks for having liquid hand soap next to the bathroom sink. I wish more hotels did this! We were very pleased with the moderate prices of the minibar items. $1.00 for a can of soda is more than reasonable by hotel standards. A full bottle of wine was $15.00 and champagne was $10.00. Flat panel LCD TVs mounted on the wall opened up the limited space in the room. The wallpaper needs repair in spots and carpets could use a good, deep cleaning. No great view from the room, but the large windows in the bathroom and bedroom brought in lots of natural light. The ceiling fan kept the room comfortable. The elevator has been updated, but is still very small. The size is fine for three story hotel with only 52 rooms. The lounge in the lobby was a comfortable place to meet up with our friends as the rooms we booked were not large enough to socialize in. A complimentary continental breakfast spread is offered in the lounge every morning. Parking was a reasonable $22, self-park in a secure lot. I feel there is better value to be had if you book in advance at other downtown hotels. But if you can score a discounted rate and need to be in the Lincoln Park/Boystown area, The Majestic is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at a quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoamHome
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Majestic last week. Our room was on the third floor. The bathroom was totally refurbished and the room was ample sized. There was a fridge and snacks/wine for purchase at a reasonable price. The sitting room downstairs is elegant and has a gas fireplace and comfy couches. The hotel is one block from the bus and in a quiet neighborhood. We walked around at night and felt completely safe. I don't understand the negative reviews at all. I have already booked again at this hotel because I was so pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CHWDC
Reviews.Content: I suggested this hotel to friends based on the reviews on this site, and we booked two rooms. The rate was great and the location is lovely but that's about all I can say. We were given the two rooms right off the entrance -- one door literally opened out to the reception desk and the other was right across from the breakfast room/lounge. I was worried that the noise of people entering/checking in would be annoying, but that was actually not the problem -- we spent two mostly sleepless nights due to extremely, extremely loud radiator pipes banging like clockwork every 15 to 20 minutes. (I live in an old building and understand the pros and cons of radiator heat -- but this was unbearable). We spoke to the hotel staff and all they said was basically, "well, that's why the price is so good." They did agree to "shut off" the system the second night but then restarted it at 5 or 6 AM on a Sunday (and on the day of the time change, no less.) And, there seemed to be someone walking in circles in the room above us -- the floors just kept creaking and creaking. So, we were all tired and I was pretty embarassed that I had picked the hotel. The rooms themselves were OK, although the one room literally was a kind of meeting room with a murphy bed in the wall. And there were ants in the bathroom. So the bottom line is, sorry, despite the great rate and location, I can't recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “very cozy at a good price”
Reviews.Author: forre011
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our trip to Chicago and our stay at The Majestic. It is a very cozy, charming little place. While I'll agree that the parking situation isn't ideal, even walking a couple blocks in the cold didn't ruin our moods. The room was small, but big enough for us, with comfy bed linens and a nice hot shower at a good price. A pretty cheap cab ride to the Sears Tower and while we didn't walk too far in the freezing weather, there are restaurants and stuff to do in walking distance. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place in Lincoln Park”
Reviews.Author: brijoli
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is simply that as a nice quaint cute neighborhood hotel within walking distance to everything. I have been staying here since it was the Brompton and love the fresh touches every time I come back. This past stay was wonderful from my check-in with Richard to my delightful conversation with Mona. The staff is great. Rooms are great, while they are Chicago size, they are clean and comfortable. I love the beds at this hotel. Love the large bathroom as well. The Majestic makes you feel comfortable and at home.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Majestic Enough, but Parking Sucks”
Reviews.Author: MidtownDetroitGirl
Reviews.Content: Great Lincoln Park location, and the rooms are trendy. Comfortable beds, big flat screen TV, nice sized shower, free wi-fi, very neat, and excellent down comforters. I planned to stay the weekend in Lincoln Park, so the area is perfect. Some of the city's best sushi restaurants, cocktail lounges, and clothing stores. Getting in is a total [--], however. There is no place to leave your car when you are checking in...we just had to park in the middle of the street and pray nobody hit us! You get parking in a garage that is about two blocks away. The front desk manager made a big show of telling us how to get in...but he was totally wrong. You have to circle the block and enter from the other side, otherwise you have to do a three point turn in your car, and you won't set off the sensor for the gate to open. It took us 20 minutes to get into the parking garage. Really, really. not what my friends needed after driving nine hours straight to meet me in the city. Nice hotel, just lose the front desk dude, or find some other parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean place”
Reviews.Author: Grotbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Majestic hotel from 20-22 November 2009 (weekend) as it was close to my sister-in-law's place. The hotel was very clean and room we had was good size. The mistake we made was having ground floor room. They only have a couple rooms on the ground level, but with that you get all the noise of the staff getting breakfast room ready. I would definitely stay again, but request a top floor. The internet was a free wi-fi connection with no security on it. I only used it with my Palm Treo and the speed seemed good. The really nice of hotel was that free coffee was available all day. They even had real cups you could use in the lounge area or take back to your room plus styrofoam to go cups. We never did take advantage of the afternoon tea which provided cookies. The breakfast included hard boiled eggs, bagels, muffins, yogurt, and cereal. The lounge (where breakfast was available) was prim and proper and no TV. I like watching the morning news, so just grabbed the breakfast on the provided trays and went back up to room. Being just a couple short blocks from Addison 152 bus stop made it easy to get from and to airport without having to use a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great area!”
Reviews.Author: deltadarling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Majestic Hotel, and we could not have had a better experience. Like most who stay here, we chose the hotel because of its proximity to Wrigley Field. Upon arrival, we found that most of the restaurants we wanted to visit were in the vacinity as well! Lucky's, featured on Man vs Food on the Travel Channel, was amazing!! We went there twice for an awesome yet cheap meal. Yes, the rooms are small, but so what? They are immaculately clean, and the beds are ridiculously comfortable. What more do you need? Mona, at the front desk, was very helpful with everything, as was everyone else we came in contact with during our stay. The common room was wonderfully decorated and a nice continental breakfast was served in the morning. Cookies were served in the afternoon, and coffee was served all day (which was wonderful). I found that my favorite thing about the hotel was the location. We were literally a half block from Lake Michigan. There is an awesome park next to the lake, and we actually joined the locals and went for a few runs in the mornings. It was great. It was never noisy, and every street around us was completely lined with beautiful trees. I miss it now. We will definitely be returning to the Majestic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely hotel on the city's north side”
Reviews.Author: Mira0708
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend here. This is a quiet relaxing boutique hotel in a nice residential neighborhood on Chicago's north side. If you want glamour & glitz, a pool/sauna, or have the desire to see & be seen, then you should stay at one of the high-rise hotels on the Magnificent Mile. But, if you want a very nice, comfortable, pretty, good quality small European style hotel, then this is a lovely place. I used to live in Chicago and love this north side neighborhood - stroll around the neighborhood and find great local restaurants, coffeehouses, bars, boutiques. Close to Wrigley Field. Easy access to stroll through Lincoln Park. Walk just one block east and it's easy to hail a cab. The closest El stop is about a 10-min walk. (For Shabbat observers it is within walking distance to at least 2 shuls.) I definitely recommend paying a little extra to get one of the suites - this will give you a bigger room, a sun porch with additional seating area, and a little fridge & microwave. It's a small increase in price compared to a regular room and a big difference in what you get. Very comfortable bed (wonderful soft comforter) and nice bathroom. Nice staff. I will definitely stay here on my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: jwinhsv
Reviews.Content: In retrospect, the location wasn't as desirable as we'd hoped. Yes, we could walk to a few locations, but many other areas would have been more convenient. Pros: Very pleasant common areas, room itself was clean, quiet, and comfortable. Cons: Room was on the small and dark side. Internet service was unreliable. Front desk clerk was rude and unhelpful. Parking was definitely problematic and inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: retired056
Reviews.Content: We stayed off season and had a 3 day special that put the room price down to about $80/night. The room was near the lake and about 1/2 mile from Wrigley Field and the train/subway. The front room/library was very comfortable and had a simple continental breakfast, The rooms were on the small side with a very comfortable queen bed. The bathroom was simple with a tub/shower combo. The soaps were nice and the room as well as the hotel was very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was a little on the warm side; but I tended to find that most businesses kept their places warm. I guess that they were doing you a favor by keeping their places warm but it became kind of a hassle trying to put on and peel off clothing, but that's the way colder climates seem to deal with the cold. The train is the best and cheapest was to get around and if you don't mind a nice, safe walk this place will serve you well.

Reviews.Title: “It Kinda Sucked”
Reviews.Author: eeyore0922
Reviews.Content: First off, I had called to ask if the hotel had a pool or hot tub. The person I spoke with said there was no pool, but there was a hot tub. Well there was no hot tub. Also the front desk attendant was kinda snobby. It seems like a place for older people that are in bed at eleven on a saturday night, not the younger crowd even tho it is very close to wrigleyville. The room was way too hot. The continental breakfast was ok. The parking for the hotel was two blocks away and cost an additional $22 per car. I will not stay there again. Two thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “Lake Shore Drive”
Reviews.Author: IanKate
Reviews.Content: Strangely enough, one of the main things I liked about the Majestic Hotel in Chicago was where it was: a few miles north of the city centre. It meant taking a taxi after a night out and the sight of those high-rise buildings on one side was breathtaking, particularly after dark with all those windows lit up, for mile after mile after mile. What a beautiful and memorable sight! My travelling companion and work colleague, Kate (28), is a Polish photographer and I am a Scottish journalist (74). We both live in Dublin, Ireland. We decided to go to Chicago at the last minute, Boston being our original choice, and the travel agent recommended the Majestic which was fine. The rooms are comfortable, well appointed and the free internet connection was a bonus as we both travel with our laptops. Breakfast was ok and the staff very helpful. We probably wouldn't have found Charlie Trotter's restaurant without their help. It is an amazing experience we had a 7-course dinner par excellence: about 400 dollars without wine for the two of us (we don't drink). I would class it as a Michelin 2-Star, maybe even a 3-Star, and we always choose the best restaurants in our travels, usually booking before leaving Dublin. We have visited 25 countries in the past two years, but Charle Trotter's was something special and it will always be etched in our memories. If I'm ever in that wonderful city again I will stay again in the Majestic. Ian and Kate.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rikaman
Reviews.Content: We decided on staying at the Majestic through reviews that we had seen on Trip Advisor. We were NOT disappointed! The trip was part of my 50th birthday celebration and climbing in the 'Go Vertical Chicago' Stairclimb at the Sears Tower. The hotel is on a quiet street, within easy walking distance to Lincoln Park and Wrigley Field (for Baseball season). The staff were exceptional, the room (bedroom, with sitting room, small frig and microwave, and two TV's) was very comfortable. The continental breakfast was better than most and the lounge/sitting area was very quiet and comfortable as well. Sure it's an old building with some creaks and perhaps not the first recommendation for those with children, but otherwise we would highly recommend it. Then getting around Chicago is made very easy by the CTA (their 'L' trains and buses). If you're there for 2+ days, you'll want to purchase a multiple day pass. There are also passes I believe called the 'City Pass' which gives you bus access plus tickets into a number of events around the city. Things we'd recommend...The Shedd Aquarium, the Sears Tower and/or the Hancock building, plenty of athletic or theater events. We were there a bit late for the tours around the city, but I hear these are wonderful as well. We are not typically 'Big City' folks, but we really enjoyed our stay in Chicago. It all began with a comfortable 4 nights stay at the Majestic. We'll be back. Go Cubbies! And da Bears!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Corvidae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I moved out of a Loop hotel to the Majestic for several days after a conference, and were very pleased. The staff provided excellent service, the hotel is charming, and the price was about $100/night less than the conference hotel. Our room was clean and comfortable, compact but perfectly adequate (and no smaller than a "business class" room we once had in London); the window faced a small courtyard between buildings instead of overlooking the street, but that helped make it quiet at night. The neighborhood nearby is full of small shops and restaurants, and has at least two large grocery stores. The hotel's continental breakfast includes not only bagels and muffins, but also instant oatmeal, cereals, and a variety of microwaveable breakfast sandwiches. Wireless Internet access is free (the conference hotel charged almost $15 a day). If you want to experience more of Chicago than the Loop, and plan to explore the city rather than look at it from a hotel window, the Majestic is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mab17
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel. It is a little off the beaten track of Chicago,yet is perfectly accessible to everything one might want to do in Chicago. The hotel has delicious cookies everyday and a great assortment of coffee and tea available to guests at all times. The concierge was wonderful and has many connections, thus he can set you up with a restaurant reservation, give you restaurant suggestions as well as for things to do.

Reviews.Title: “We love Chicago”
Reviews.Author: trustypoo
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay in Chicago based on Wrigley Field. We were going to Chicago to see the Cubs play for my boyfriend's 50th birthday. We arrived late to the hotel after spending the day downtown, we pulled up to the front and we very pleased with the area. Our room was small but it was very comfortable. The staff were very helpful regarding places to eat and bus schedules. The breakfast was just enough to get us going for the day. We would recommend The Majestic Hotel for anyone going to see the Cubs. It was a nice short walk to the ballgame. Chicago is a very friendly and clean city. We will be back again. Go Cubs!!

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood hotel with solid amenities”
Reviews.Author: BostonDavid
Reviews.Content: Returned to my old hometown of Chicago to visit friends and wanted t a hotel north of downtown and came upon this place. Had a suite which was very capacious and decently appointed. Price for weekend was at top end of their rates due to festival in neighborhood. Was able to find street parking w/in two blocks so didn't pay for hotel lot. Definitely good for those up for Cubs games or boystown. Both well in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Computeress
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean and quiet hotel. My first time visiting the Chicago area in a while. This hotel is in a very nice nieghborhood. I would suggest getting a CTA (Chicago Transit Authority) Visitor pass. Unlimited rides and the price varies on the amount of days; $5 per day for a one day pass down to $8 for a three day pass. Chicago drivers are very agressive! Take the bus, subway or EL. Our suite did not have a very good view...overlooked a 23 floor building on the east side. Nice continental breakfast and the Tea/Coffee and cookies in the afternoon is very nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “What a charming Suprise!”
Reviews.Author: JiminLancaster
Reviews.Content: Located on a quiet street and close to Public Transportation (100 Yard walk) this Lakeview/Wrigleyville gem is perfect for a city getaway. There are several great restaurants nearby. The front desk staff was friendly and knowledgeable. My room was a little small, but for a city hotel I found it quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: IrishPrincess57
Reviews.Content: Actually got what I expected, how rare is that? This lovely hotel is on a quiet street and if it weren't for the occasional door opening and closing in the hallways, I would have thought we had the hotel to ourselves. What I didn't expect was the rooms to be large, airy and comfortable. The staff was fantastic and friendly. Loved the amenities, continental breakfast in the morning and cookies in the afternoon; frig, microwave & wet bar in the room. The bed was comfy, though the hide a bed wasn't both as a couch & a bed. The housekeeping was excellent...they even turned in my lost earrings. Easy walking distance to Wrigley Field and the local bus stops. It was so easy to get downtown that we always took the buses. If I ever return to Chicago, I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: kkmrag
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel near Lake Shore drive north of downtown Chicago. Great price for its location. The hotel is old, with an old fashioned elevator that is charming but very inconvenient when you have luggage. The rooms and furnishing are old but the rooms are clean. A generous breakfast is complimentary. Some of the staff are more helpful than others though all I encountered are friendly. This hotel has an arrangement with a parking garage next door which made parking a breeze. Overall I had a pleasant stay for the price and would recommend this hotel to people not seeking luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this spot”
Reviews.Author: JAX148
Reviews.Content: We travel to Chicago two or three times a year (both our sons work in the city and live in the Wrigley area). Usually we stay in the Magnificent Mile area but decided to try a hotel closer to where our sons live. What a pleasant surprise! The Majestic is a wonderful boutique hotel with lots of ambience, a friendly and helpful staff, located in a great neighborhood, and within walking distance to an array of neighborhood restaurants. We stayed in a standard room with a queen bed. The furnishings were new along with new carpet and recently renovated bathroom. Our room was smaller than we normally book but comfortable and very clean.. Before we arrived we were a little concerned about the parking situation because of what we had read on some previous reviews. However, we found the parking,(a secure garage right behind the hotel) to be great. It was half the price of most of the downtown hotels with unlimited in/out privileges. Driving a car in Chicago is a hastle and cabs are not always plentiful, not like New York cabs. On this trip the hotel manager suggested we try the express bus for our day time trips...what a great find! You can buy a 24 hour pass for $5(the hotel has them) and the bus stops right outside the hotel on Inner Lake Shore Drive...a very easy and convenient way to travel. We will definitely stay at this hotel on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Value”
Reviews.Author: shakephx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights. Even though we made our reservations months in advance we were stuck in a small room with a view of the rear alley. Window air conditioner became covered when we closed curtains so had to jury-rig curtains to allow a/c to cool room while maintaining our privacy. Only one unloading car space in front that is not policed very well. Front desk staff watched me struggle down indoor entry steps with luggage and did not volunteer to help. I'd gladly pay a little more for at least one bellman. Continental breakfast was generic. Only one evening restaurant within walking distance... and it is an Itanian place that did not impress us. The building is just fine and the sitting/dining room is nice. Bed was comfortable. Would I stay here again? Maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Messed up our booking+service and standards are pretty average”
Reviews.Author: VelvetElf
Reviews.Content: This could be such a great hotel. Its in a great neighbourhood. But it falls short on service and needs updating. We were kept waiting at the check in desk, until it became clear to us that the hotel had messed up our booking. These things happen, but they didnt apologise until pressed and they refused to provide us with the type of room that we had booked. We were basically treated as though we had no booking, even though I had the confirmation printed out. We had travelled a long way adn didnt feel very welcome at all. The hotel itself is ok. The bedroom furniture is ready for an update and the serviec is indifferent. Our room was little a bit noisy at night and the hotel was definately more noisy and rowdy at the weekend when a baseball game was on nearby. The communal lounge area is a higher standard, but having breakfast in there is strange- its sofas and side tables only. Breakfast is ok- but all pre-packaged, no fresh fruit or hot food. On the plus side, it is clean and in a good neighbourhood. Its easy to travel into town (you can buy all travel tickets from the front desk- but you have to ask them about it). Its also within easy walking distance of lots of great hip eating places in the 'boystown' neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: curlykale
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our week stay at the Majestic, the staff were all friendly and made us feel as if we were at home. The place is beautiful, very quiet at night and the bed is just so comfy, we slept like babies. The complementary breakfast is great for light breakfast eaters. The elevator is small, two people plus luggage is comfortable but we took the stairs most of the time. The linens and bath robes were very plush. Chicago will always be a special city for us and with the memories of staying at the Majestic makes it a slice of heaven. Go Cubs!!

Reviews.Title: “A Homerun!”
Reviews.Author: boosy
Reviews.Content: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED IF COMING IN TOWN FOR CUBS GAMES. I found this hotel by reading reviews on this website when looking for hotels close to Wrigley Field. Everything said they were the closest and within walking distance, and I contacted them to make sure this was true. I was looking for a close place to stay since I was coming from STL and taking my Cubs' fan boyfriend (I know it's hard to believe since I'm a Cardinals fan) to his first game at Wrigley, and wanted to be able to walk since I knew we'd be drinking and wanted to avoid the hassle of getting there. This place was a real find. The several times I had talked to someone at the hotel on the phone they were very friendly and helpful. This was the same when we arrived. It is a very quaint little hotel in the middle of a bustling, nice old neighborhood. Yes, it is old (quaint implies this) and does have window A/C units, but this didn't bother us at all. The room and bathroom were very clean. Landscaping and flowers and people out and about made walking around there enjoyable and felt safe.
