The walk to Wrigley is about half a mile, and there's plenty of stores/restaurants all around within walking distance. Just ask the front desk for anything in particular and they will kindly direct you there. The room we stayed in was one of the larger (the king with sunroom) and it was very nice and comfortable and welcoming. The hotel overall is welcoming as soon as you walk in and see the cozy lobby/sitting room (always with free coffee). Parking is down a few blocks but still convenient considering the sparse parking availabilty, and pretty reasonable at $22/day for Chicago. Although the Cubs lost, staying here was part of how enjoyable our trip was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice neighbourhood hotel”
Reviews.Author: London_Austin
Reviews.Content: This is a quaint hotel in a leafy street, quiet but very close by to Wrigley Field and the surrounding neighbourhood with plenty of bars and restaurants. We arrived in the afternoon, just in time for the complimentary tea and cookies which are served in the attractive sitting room. A nice touch. We stayed only one night and maybe for that reason were given a room adjacent to the elevator, which had the elevator shaft in one corner of our room. Fortunately there was no noise from it so it did not affect our stay. The room and en-suite bathroom were quite small but clean and presentable. Complimentary breakfast is provided, but as a European I found it to be quite poor, with packaged muffins, paper cups and plates - nothing very appetising or of good quality. Othen than that though, no complaints. The Majestic has character and is a comfortable hotel in a very pleasant area of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in a nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Foster32
Reviews.Content: This quiet hotel offers: two room suites, above average breakfast, a lovely lobby, a very friendly staff, a quiet neighborhood. Each room is 12 x 22, and is connected by a small pantry with fridge and microwave. The breakfast has fruit, pastries, cereal, yogurt, coffee, teas, juice. Sounds normal, but it is presented very nicely. The lobby is an english manor setting with plush chairs, sofas and tables for lounging. You can have afternoon coffee, tea and cookies here. The staff are a pleasure to talk to. The neighborhood is safe. There are good restuarants nearby on Broadway (go to Angelinas). Wrigley Field is about 7 bocks away. You can park in the neighborhood and save garage parking. Rooms go for $130-160 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Things I would want to know...”
Reviews.Author: BeanieM
Reviews.Content: Here are some of the things I like to know about a hotel, particularly in Chicago, and I hope this helps: LOCATION: Fantastic for Wrigleyville (Cubs games), I think someone else mentioned "Boystown" but best of all - quick & easy access (2 blocks) to Lakeshore Drive which is so convenient (make sure you know what you are wanting/needing to be close to in Chicago as this is not ideal for many locations such as Univ of Chicago area or near airports). SAFETY: It is on a narrow, tree-lined, residential apartment-heavy street where you'll see people walking, dog-walking which made me feel relatively safe. PARKING: If you are driving - NO easy parking & at times, NO parking. You can luck out and possibly park on the street (rare opening) or you can resort to using the large apartment building's miniature parking garage next door. It's VERY expensive. I think someone mentioned that you must drive around the block and go in the back to park, but there is a way to navigate through the garage back to the front of the of the block, turn right and you are at the Majestic front door. ROOMS: Very small but clean. Nice bed, decent linens. Clean bathrooms. Robe was plush to the touch but not used as it had dried shaving cream or mousse on the collar (not clean). Small TV which is fine for a very small room. As it is a much older building, also can hear most everything on floor, doors, creaking wooden floor halls. ELEVATOR: One. Tiny. Difficult to get luggage for 1 person and yourself on the elevator but there is a large staircase. Library/Living Room/LOBBY combo: Dark wood. Lovely. Coffee, tea, breads in the early mornings. OVERALL: Would stay here again for a Cubs game, maybe a short vacation, otherwise I probably wouldn't.

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way, but otherwise a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: benv
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is somewhat out of the way, situated on a quiet, tree-lined, residential side street just a block from Lake Michigan and close to Wrigley Field. Plenty of good restaurants are just a few blocks away (easy walking distance), and we had no trouble getting a cab just a block away along Lakeshore Drive. The room was a little small, but plenty comfortable and extremely clean. And the bathroom was terrific: big, bright, and clean, with a great shower. Staff weren't overly effusive, but were friendly and helpful enough--we certainly had no problems. In all, it was efficient, quiet, and comfortable, all for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Cubs fans!”
Reviews.Author: NOTL
Reviews.Content: My 3 children and I (15, 11 and 6) spent one night at the Majestic while in town for a Cubs game. Our experience was fantastic! We parked on the south side of Addison (free) and walked with our bags to the hotel, which was just around the block. Our room was lovely, a suite with 2 queen beds and a pull out in the living room area. The beds were cozy and the room was delightful; very old fashioned charm, yet clean and inviting. The bathroom was updated and clean with nice toiletries. Window air conditioners were running when we arrived, so the room was nice and cool. Great neighborhood; we walked to Wrigley for the game and also walked home after, which was about 10:00 pm and felt very safe. I'm saying this as a woman with children. It's a great residential area. Staff was courteous and overall, the hotel was wonderful. Don't hesitate to stay here, especially if in town for a Cubs game! We will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Going to Wrigley? Stay at Majestic”
Reviews.Author: moseylou
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Chicago to visit Wrigley Field for the first time. We were going to two games, so we really wanted to stay in the neighborhood. I found the Majestic through this website, and I highly recommend it. It's a 10 minute walk from the field. If you are tired, the 152 runs often (although before and the after the game the traffic is slow on Addison, so it's quicker to walk) and drops you off a block from the hotel. It's a block in from Lake Shore Drive, so accessible to the marvelous bus system that will take you speedily downtown as well. We stayed in a suite, which was great. The room was immaculate, the staff were extremely helpful and friendly, the continental breakfast had the basics of bagels, croissants, cereal, some fruit, and yogurt. Good to get you going on your day. Free tea, coffee, lemonade and juice all day. What was remarkable was how QUIET the hotel was at night, given that it was full. Nary a sound awoke me. The only complaint is the uncomfortable sofa bed in the living room of the suite. We had six people in the room, so we had to utilize the sofa bed, and it was so uncomfortable for me that I opted to sleep on the floor with the sofa cushions as my bed. But, then again, how often does one find a really comfortable sofa bed? So, if you are traveling to Chicago with Wrigley and the Cubs as your focus, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Option in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, a little background. I grew up in Chicago, and lived in Lakeview for over ten years before moving to Amsterdam. My wife is British, and her family used to run a bed & breakfast in Devon, UK. I say this because at this point in time I think we are in a good position to recoomend the Majestic. This hotel does a good job of providing a relaxing atmosphere. It has a European/English B&B feel in that the rooms vary in size, has a nice sitting area, no parking facility, and is on a quaint residential street. My wife felt more comfortable here than any other place we have stayed when in the states. Yes, many of the rooms have next to no view, but same can be said about many of the rooms in downtown Chicago as well most of the hotels in London. For a leisure traveller to Chicago (without kids), it has the most important quality a hotel needs to have: a very comfortable place to start and end each day. For travelers with kids, there is this concept called a CITY PARK literally two blocks away; complete with playgound, tennis courts, softball fields, a beach for dogs, a golf course, and even a totem pole. The hotel is a little over four miles north of the loop, Navy Pier, Millenium Park, and Grant Park. Being a half block off the lake, it is a perfect distance for an early morning run before work or play. There are options of a free quick continental breakfast in the hotel or a number of good breakfast places nearby, such as Ann Sathers, IHOP, or Nookies. There is a Starbucks, Einstien's bagels, and Caribou Coffee within walking distance. All of which are not far off the path to the El, and have high cab traffic going by. As far as the parking goes, if your willing to walk a couple blocks and willing to abide by the closing hours, there is the option of parking on the other side of Lake Shore Drive in the park. As far as the elevator, gimme a break. The place is only four stories high including the ground floor. A hotel should compliment a vacation, not BE the vacation. The Majestic as a perfect compliment.

Reviews.Title: “Alway Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: sdak74
Reviews.Content: Love the Majestic. Great location for nightlife and sports (Wrigley is within walking distance). The red line is only a couple of blocks away. Rooms are well appointed and clean. If you are looking for a large hotel with restaraunts and things for the kids to do, this isn't it. If you are looking for a elegant boutique hotel refuge from the hustle and bustle of the city, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccably clean, awesome beds, outstanding staff at the Majestic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently I had to rush to Chicago to see my adult son who was in the hospital. I went right from the airport to the hospital. Upon arriving at the Majestic Hotel I was exhausted. I was greeted by a charming woman who recognized how tired I was and wanted me to be comfortable. I had booked a suite ahead of time in the hopes that my son could stay with me a couple of days upon discharge from the hospital. I was shown a couple of different rooms and asked which one I wanted. The beds are incredibly comfortable and the rooms immaculate. The hotel is in a very quiet neighborhood near wonderful restaurants and bus lines for easy access to downtown Chicago. As it turned out, my stay at the Majestic Hotel was 10 nights! I was treated like family. As a matter of fact, my husband and parents joined me toward the end of the stay and they also couldnâ€™t say enough wonderful things about the Majestic Hotel and its staff. If you want wonderful beds, clean and quiet rooms, free continental breakfast (with excellent coffee- I am pretty particular about my coffee), check out this hotel. My family and I will definitely stay there when we visit Chicago again. Having traveled with children for years I know the kind of activities and environment they enjoy. The Majestic does not have the water activities and play areas that children and their parents enjoy. However, if you want a quiet, comfortable stay with delightful staff, then stay at the Majestic. My thanks especially to Sarita for accommodating my schedule and room requests and particularly that upgrade for my mom and dad to that beautiful suite with the porch. Thank you also to Dana, Uzi and Roxanna- you guys are terrific. Thank you. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had researched better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to find and had a nice location. The rooms were nice, comfortable and clean. The atmosphere was elegant. That sums up all the good things about this hotel. For the price we paid to stay there for five nights, we were very disappointed, right from the beginning. When we arrived at the hotel with our children (no extra little perks for kids by the way) and our many bags, we were not offered any help with our luggage. We struggled into the hotel with kids in tow and had no idea where to park or how to get all our bags in while blocking the street. The lady at the desk directed my husband where to park (which was a parking garage you entered by going around the block)(leaving out the information on how to get back in the building without walking around the entire block) and after asking if I needed help with all of our luggage, (FINALLY), she, rather than grabbing any bags, picked up my two year old son. We spotted a rack to put all our bags on (rather than her letting us know there was one) and we then had to squeeze luggage and family into their very small elevator to get to our room. Never having been to Chicago, and arriving close to dinnertime, we were hungry and had no idea where to go for food. This hotel has no restaurants and no room service (the few times we called down to ask a question or needed something we were told to come down to the desk and they would help us). Therefore, the first night we asked the front desk where a family might go to eat a family friendly casual dinner within walking distance. They sent us to an Italian candleit restaurant (granted, within walking distance) where our children had no room to be comfortable and we could not even read the menu. We left there shortly after we arrived and instead walked to a carry out place we had spotted two doors down that had a very family friendly menu and atmosphere. (thank goodness) As far as breakfast, the Majestic does have a continental breakfast consisting of juice, coffee, bagels and croissants. However, not something you want to eat every morning for any length of time. They offer cookies and coffee in the evening. They are supposed to offer coffee and tea 24 hours a day but more than twice when I attempted to get coffee the canisters were empty. As far as friendliness, they always had a smile for my son when we came out of our room, but not even a hello to my daughter or the rest of the family. We enjoyed our daytimes in Chicago, but found in the evenings, we were stuck in the hotel with nothing to do. This hotel was a definite disappointment. If ever a next time in Chicago, we will definitely better research where to stay and find a place with a pool, a restaurant (and room service) and friendlier and more helpful staff for the money we shelled out at the Majestic.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique is the right word”
Reviews.Author: tg1946
Reviews.Content: Boutique is the right word for this hotel. My flight back east was cancelled due to February blizzard and I was very pleased to find the Majestic--great quality at $89. Rooms are small but mine was quiet, lovely toiletries and comfy robe, good mattress and bedding, very friendly and helpful staff, elevator is european (tiny), but, hey, it beats the stairs with luggage. Breakfast not special, but available in a nice setting. And everything very clean, the whole hotel is non-smoking. We stay at so-called boutique hotels in New York City now and then and have found that means small, dark, and not all that clean, so this was a nice surprise. And location is terrific, near the lake and everything else on the North side.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a trip to visit a friend and found the accomodations to be very nice. It is an older building with some charm. The people who work there are friendly and it feels more like a B & B than a hotel. The library or lobby area is very nice with a fire place and coffee available 24hrs. The elevator is small but functional. The room was nice, clean and very roomy. The bed was the best part. It was firm and nice---had the best sleep while I was there. The TV is small and the shower head was good. There is no restaurant but some neighborhood restaurants near by and a supermarket within walking distance. All in all a good decent place not fancy but comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic Majestic”
Reviews.Author: mike3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Majestic this past weekend. I love this hotel. This is the second time I have stayed here and had an even better experience. It is a European style hotel with a lot of charm. It is convenient to the Wrigleyville and "Boystown" area. Located on a quiet street. The rooms are small, but comfortable. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was also very clean and seemed updated. They also had very nice and high quality products in the bathroom (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, and bath salts). The robes were a nice touch. The staff was professional and friendly. Check out time is 11:00 a.m. - they allowed us to stay until 1:00 p.m. because we had a later flight that evening. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: qman55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic over memorial weekend and the stay was fabulous. The rooms aren't smaller than normal than from your standard cookie cutter hotels but the hotel has charm. Very cozy place to stay with it fine sitting room that is used for their continental breakfast. Its so comfortable and it makes it easy for people to feel at home. short blocks to wrigley field, and even shorter walk to the L to get all over the city. We love the area with its great dining, little shops and full size grocery/ pharm for everything you may forgotten

Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: Hans_Staden
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Majestic for a couple of times during tha last ten years. Very nice neighborhood, and it by now feel like home away from home. But the rooms have very different quality (avoid rooms near the elevator!), the breakfast has deteriorated during the years (alsthough it was always plastic). The bathrooms are mostly ok, the toiletries supplied are excellent, the parlour where tea and breakfast are supplied is a nice cozy reading room (for those who need this in Chicago). Very friendly, helpful an knowledgable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and inviting get-away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the sunroom suite at the Majestic Hotel and had a pleasurable experience. The spacious sunroom suite was clean and comfortable; it felt like we didn't leave home. Coffee breaks and cookies add a sweet touch. The neighborhood provides a lot of entertainment and the Majestic Hotel is conveniently located around classic restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends.
